text: us judge has ruled that a congressional
committee investigating the january the
sixth attack on congress can access some
of former president trump's white house
records the ruling came hours after the
congressional committee issued subpoenas
to 10 more trump administration
officials including a former senior
adviser and his press secretary in a
statement donald trump condemned the
committee and repeated false claims that
the election was fraudulent our north
america correspondent peter bose has
more details now about what this might
mean in terms of mr trump's white house
records
we understand that these are memos
between president and presidential aides
telephone records visitor logs so it's
clear that the committee wants to get a
picture of who was arriving at the white
house perhaps who was meeting with the
president the kind of conversations that
he was having in the days leading up to
the attack on congress on january the
6th and they will now get those
documents they are likely to be handed
over from
the officials that are keeping them at
the moment on friday unless president
trump former president trump goes back
to court and gets this in front of an
appeal court that could delay the
process but at the moment this seems to
be quite a victory for the congressional
committee
